Organizational Structure

  • Chair

    • Secretary of Transportation (www.dot.gov)

  • Members

    • Secretary of Agriculture (www.usda.gov)
    • Secretary of Commerce (www.commerce.gov)
    • Attorney General (www.usdoj.gov)
    • Secretary of Defense (www.defenselink.mil)
    • Secretary of Labor (www.dol.gov)
    • Secretary of Homeland Security (www.dhs.gov)
    • Secretary of Energy (www.energy.gov)
    • Secretary of the Treasury (www.treasury.gov)
    • Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff (www.jcs.mil)
    • Secretary of State (www.state.gov)
    • Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency (www.epa.gov)
    • Secretary of the Interior (www.doi.gov)
    • Chairman of the Federal Maritime Commission (www.fmc.gov)
    • Chairman of the Marine Mammal Commission (www.mmc.gov)
    • Chairman of the National Transportation Safety Board (www.ntsb.gov)
    • * Council on Environmental Quality Chair (Acting) (www.whitehouse.gov/ceq)
    • * Assistant to the President for Homeland Security and Counterterrorism (www.whitehouse.gov/nsc/staff)
    • * Assistant to the President for Domestic Policy (US Domestic Policy Council)
    • * Assistant to the President for Economic Policy (US National Economic Council)
    • * Assistant to the President for Science and Technology Policy (www.whitehouse.gov/ostp)
    • * Director of the Office of Management and Budget (www.whitehouse.gov/omb)
    • * Director of the National Ocean Council (National Ocean Policy)
    • * Advisor to the President on National Security (www.whitehouse.gov/nsc)
    • * Director, National Maritime Intelligence-Integration Office (nmio.ise.gov/)
    • * Pursuant to 46 U.S.C. § 55502(c)(2), the Committee shall include as non-voting.

  • Dept Of The Interior
  • Federal Maritime Commission



The CMTS serves as a Federal interagency coordinating committee for the purpose of assessing the adequacy of the marine transportation system, promoting the integration of the marine transportation system with other modes of transportation and other uses of the marine environment, and coordinating, improving the coordination of, and making recommendations with regard to Federal policies that impact the marine transportation system.
Contact Us:
Committee on the Marine Transportation System
Office of the Executive Secretariat
U.S. Department of Transportation
1200 New Jersey Ave SE
Washington, DC 20590
(202) 366-3612
info@cmts.gov
